metadata.title: CVE-2021-3744 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernel in theccp_run_aes_gcm_cmd() function in drivers/crypto/ccp/ccp-ops.c, whichallows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). Thisvulnerability is similar with the older CVE-2019-18808.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
